rules.natural: If the documentary network sponsors the wildlife show, then the production completes the wildlife documentary.
If advanced imaging technology is available, then the production uses advanced imaging technology.
Either advanced imaging technology is available or DNA sequencing technology is available.
Provided that the ethics board approves medical procedures, then if DNA sequencing technology is available, the production uses DNA sequencing technology.
Should the regulatory agency approve medical procedures, then if DNA sequencing technology is available, the production uses DNA sequencing technology.
When emergency surgery is scheduled, then either the ethics board approves medical procedures or the regulatory agency approves medical procedures.
Under the condition that quarantine protocol is scheduled, then either the ethics board approves medical procedures or the regulatory agency approves medical procedures.
Either the production violates animal welfare standards or the production completes the wildlife documentary.
If the crew follows safety protocols, then the production does not violate animal welfare standards.
Either a disease outbreak occurs or if the crew does not follow safety protocols, then filming continues in a controlled environment.
If the clinic implements biosecurity measures, then a disease outbreak does not occur.
Either the clinic implements biosecurity measures or the production implements containment protocols.
Provided that the production implements containment protocols, then a disease outbreak does not occur.
If the crew wears protective gear, then the crew follows safety protocols.
Either a medical emergency interrupts filming or the crew wears protective gear.
If the camera crew documents treatment procedures, then a medical emergency does not interrupt filming.
Either the camera crew documents treatment procedures or the producer interviews veterinary staff.
Should the producer interview veterinary staff, then a medical emergency does not interrupt filming.
If the documentary network airs behind-the-scenes footage, then the documentary generates public awareness.
Either the documentary network airs behind-the-scenes footage or if the crew films rehabilitation progress, then filming continues in a controlled environment.

If the veterinarian treats the sick animal, then provided that it is not the case that if the documentary network does not sponsor the wildlife show then the wildlife show features endangered species, then the production does not require special permits.
If the veterinarian diagnoses a zoonotic disease, then the veterinarian treats the sick animal.
Either the production cancels the filming schedule or the veterinarian diagnoses a zoonotic disease.
If the production uses advanced imaging technology, then equipment failure does not delay the broadcast.
Provided that the production uses DNA sequencing technology, then equipment failure does not delay the broadcast.
If neither emergency surgery is scheduled nor quarantine protocol is scheduled, then the production schedule conflicts with medical care.
Should neither emergency surgery be scheduled nor quarantine protocol be scheduled, then the production schedule does not conflict with medical care.
If it is not the case that if the documentary network does not sponsor the wildlife show then the wildlife show features endangered species, then the production requires special permits.
Provided that the crew does not follow safety protocols, then the crew films rehabilitation progress.
If the crew does not follow safety protocols, then filming does not continue in a controlled environment.
If the production does not complete the wildlife documentary, then equipment failure delays the broadcast.
